section.name: JPA : XML Metadata Reference
section.p: JPA XML MetaData allows you to define mapping information but in a separate file (orm.xml) separating persistence mapping from your model. What follows provides a reference guide to MetaData elements. Here is an example header for orm.xml files with XSD specification
If using any of the DataNucleus extensions, then the XSD is defined here, in which case you would define your header as :-

ul.li:
entity-mappings
description
persistence-unit-metadata
xml-mapping-metadata-complete
package
schema
catalog
access
sequence-generator
table-generator
named-query
query
named-native-query
query
sql-result-set-mapping
entity-result
field-result
column-result
mapped-superclass
description
id-class
exclude-default-listeners
exclude-superclass-listeners
entity-listeners
entity-listener
pre-persist
post-persist
pre-remove
post-remove
pre-update
post-update
post-load
pre-persist
post-persist
pre-remove
post-remove
pre-update
post-update
post-load
attributes
Same elements as under <entity>-><attributes>
entity
description
table
unique-constraint
column-name
index
secondary-table
primary-key-join-column
primary-key-foreign-key
unique-constraint
column-name
index
primary-key-join-column
primary-key-foreign-key
id-class
datastore-id
column
generated-value
surrogate-version
column

id

lob

subsection.name: Metadata for description tag
subsection.p: The <description> element (<entity-mappings>) contains the text describing all classes (and hence entities) defined in this file. It serves no useful purpose other than descriptive.

subsection.name: Metadata for xml-mapping-metadata-complete tag
subsection.p: The <xml-mapping-metadata-complete> element (under <persistence-unit-metadata>) when specified defines that the classes in this file are fully specified with just their metadata and that any annotations should be ignored.

subsection.name: Metadata for package tag
subsection.p: The <package> element (under <entity-mappings>) contains the text defining the package into which all classes in this file belong.

subsection.name: Metadata for schema tag
subsection.p: The <schema> element (under <entity-mappings>) contains the default schema for all classes in this file.

subsection.name: Metadata for catalog tag
subsection.p: The <catalog> element (under <entity-mappings>) contains the default catalog for all classes in this file.

subsection.name: Metadata for access tag
subsection.p: The <access> element (under <entity-mappings>) contains the setting for how to access the persistent fields/properties. This can be set to either "FIELD" or "PROPERTY".

subsection.name: Metadata for sequence-generator tag
subsection.p: The <sequence-generator> element (under <entity-mappings>, or <entity> or <id>) defines a generator of sequence values, for use elsewhere in this persistence-unit.

tr.td: Number of values that the sequence allocates when needed

subsection.name: Metadata for table-generator tag
subsection.p: The <table-generator> element (under <entity-mappings>, or <entity> or <id>) defines a generator of sequence values using a datastore table, for use elsewhere in this persistence-unit.

tr.td: name of the table to use for sequences
Catalog to store the sequence table
Schema to store the sequence table
Name of the primary-key column in the table
Name of the value column in the table
Name of the value to use in the primary key column (for this row)
Initial value to use in the table
Number of values to allocate when needed

subsection.name: Metadata for named-query tag
subsection.p: The <named-query> element (under <entity-mappings> or under <entity>) defines a JPQL query that will be accessible at runtime via the name. The element itself will contain the text of the query. It has the following attributes

subsection.name: Metadata for named-native-query tag
subsection.p: The <named-native-query> element (under <entity-mappings> or under <entity>) defines an SQL query that will be accessible at runtime via the name. The element itself will contain the text of the query. It has the following attributes

subsection.name: Metadata for sql-result-set-mapping tag
subsection.p: The <sql-result-set-mapping> element (under <entity-mappings> or under <entity>) defines how the results of the SQL query are output to the user per row of the result set. It will contain sub-elements. It has the following attributes

tr.td: Name of the SQL result-set mapping (referenced by native queries)

subsection.name: Metadata for named-entity-graph tag
subsection.p: The <named-entity-graph> element (under <entity>) defines an entity graph with root as that entity, accessible at runtime via the name. It has the following attributes

subsection.name: Metadata for named-attribute-node tag
subsection.p: The <named-attribute-node> element (under <named-entity-graph>) defines a node in the entity graph. It has the following attributes

tr.td: Name of a subgraph that maps this attribute fully (optional)

subsection.name: Metadata for subgraph/subclass-subgraph tag
subsection.p: The <subgraph>/subclass-subgraph element (under <named-entity-graph>) defines a subgraph in the entity graph. It has the following attributes

tr.td: Name of the subgraph (referenced in the named-attribute-node)

subsection.name: Metadata for entity-result tag
subsection.p: The <entity-result> element (under <sql-result-set-mapping>) defines an entity that is output from an SQL query per row of the result set. It can contain sub-elements of type <field-result>. It has the following attributes

tr.td: Column containing any discriminator (so subclasses of the entity type can be distinguished)

subsection.name: Metadata for field-result tag
subsection.p: The <field-result> element (under <entity-result>) defines a field of an entity and the column representing it in an SQL query. It has the following attributes

subsection.name: Metadata for column-result tag
subsection.p: The <column-result> element (under <sql-result-set-mapping>) defines a column that is output directly from an SQL query per row of the result set. It has the following attributes

subsection.name: Metadata for mapped-superclass tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <mapped-superclass> tag (under <entity-mappings>). This is used to define the persistence definition for a class that has no table but is mapped.

tr.td: Whether the definition of persistence of this class is complete with this MetaData definition. That is, should any annotations be ignored.

subsection.name: Metadata for entity tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <entity> tag (under <entity-mappings>). This is used to define the persistence definition for this class.

tr.td: Name of the entity. Used by JPQL queries
Whether the definition of persistence of this class is complete with this MetaData definition. That is, should any annotations be ignored.
Whether instances of this class should be cached in the L2 cache. New in JPA2

subsection.name: Metadata for description tag
subsection.p: The <description> element (under <entity>) contains the text describing the class being persisted. It serves no useful purpose other than descriptive.

subsection.name: Metadata for table tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <table> tag (under <entity>). This is used to define the table where this class will be persisted.

tr.td: Catalog where the table is stored
Schema where the table is stored

subsection.name: Metadata for secondary-table tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <secondary-table> tag (under <entity>). This is used to define the join of a secondary table back to the primary table where this class will be persisted.

tr.td: Catalog where the table is stored
Schema where the table is stored

subsection.name: Metadata for join-table tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <join-table> tag (under <one-to-one>, <one-to-many>, <many-to-many>). This is used to define the join table where a collection/maps relationship will be persisted.

tr.td: Catalog where the join table is stored
Schema where the join table is stored
Whether to remove orphans when either removng the owner or nulling the relation

subsection.name: Metadata for collection-table tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <collection-table> tag (under <element-collection>). This is used to define the join table where a collections relationship will be persisted.

tr.td: Catalog where the join table is stored
Schema where the join table is stored

subsection.name: Metadata for unique-constraint tag
subsection.p: This element is specified under the <table>, <secondary-table> or <join-table> tags. This is used to define a unique constraint on the table. No attributes are provided, just sub-element(s) "column-name"

subsection.name: Metadata for column tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <column> tag (under <basic>). This is used to define the column where the data will be stored.

tr.td: Some vague JPA term that you put anything in and get any unexpected results from
Length for the column (when string type)
Precision for the column (when numeric type)
Scale for the column (when numeric type)
The JDBC Type to use for this column (DataNucleus extension)
The position to use for this column (first=0) (DataNucleus extension)

subsection.name: Metadata for primary-key-join-column tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <primary-join-key-column> tag (under <secondary-table> or <entity>). This is used to define the join of PK columns between secondary and primary tables, or between table of subclass and table of base class.

tr.td: Name of column in primary table

subsection.name: Metadata for join-column tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <join-column> tag (under <join-table>). This is used to define the join column.

tr.td: Name of the column at the other side of the relation that this is a FK to
Some vague JPA term that you put anything in and get any unexpected results from. Not supported by DataNucleus.

subsection.name: Metadata for inverse-join-column tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <inverse-join-column> tag (under <join-table>). This is used to define the join column to the element.

tr.td: Name of the column at the other side of the relation that this is a FK to
Some vague JPA term that you put anything in and get any unexpected results from. Not supported by DataNucleus.

subsection.name: Metadata for id-class tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <id-class> tag (under <entity>). This defines a identity class to be used for this entity.

subsection.name: Metadata for inheritance tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <inheritance> tag (under <entity>). This defines the inheritance of the class.

tr.td: Strategy for inheritance in terms of storing this class

subsection.name: Metadata for discriminator-value tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <discriminator-value> tag (under <entity>). This defines the value used in a discriminator. The value is contained in the element. Specification of the value will result in a "value-map" discriminator strategy being adopted. If no discriminator-value is present, but discriminator-column is then "class-name" discriminator strategy is used.

subsection.name: Metadata for discriminator-column tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <discriminator-column> tag (under <entity>). This defines the column used for a discriminator.

tr.td: Type of data stored in the discriminator column

subsection.name: Metadata for id tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <id> tag (under <attributes>). This is used to define the field used to be the identity of the class.

subsection.name: Metadata for generated-value tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <generated-value> tag (under <id>). This is used to define how to generate the value for the identity field.

tr.td: Generation strategy. Please refer to the Identity Generation Guide
Name of the generator to use if wanting to override the default DataNucleus generator for the specified strategy. Please refer to the <sequence-generator> and <table-generator>

subsection.name: Metadata for datastore-id tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <datastore-id> tag (under <id>). This is used to define the entity is using datastore identity (DataNucleus extension).

tr.td: Name of the surrogate column to add for the datastore identity.
Details of the generated value strategy and generator. Please refer to the <generated-value>

subsection.name: Metadata for surrogate-version tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <surrogate-version> tag (under <id>). This is used to define the entity has a surrogate version column (DataNucleus extension).

tr.td: Name of the surrogate column to add for the version.
Whether the surrogate version column should be indexed.

subsection.name: Metadata for embedded-id tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <embedded-id> tag (under <attributes>). This is used to define the field used to be the (embedded) identity of the class. Note that this is not yet fully supported - specify the fields in the class

subsection.name: Metadata for version tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <version> tag (under <attributes>). This is used to define the field used to be hold the version of the class.

subsection.name: Metadata for basic tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <basic> tag (under <attributes>). This is used to define the persistence information for the field.

tr.td: Whether this field may be null and may be used in schema generation

subsection.name: Metadata for temporal tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <temporal> tag (under <basic>). This is used to define the details of persistence as a temporal type. The contents of the element can be one of DATE, TIME, TIMESTAMP.

subsection.name: Metadata for enumerated tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <enumerated> tag (under <basic>). This is used to define the details of persistence as an enum type. The contents of the element can be one of ORDINAL or STRING to represent whether the enum is persisted as an integer-based or the actual string.

subsection.name: Metadata for one-to-one tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <one-to-one> tag (under <attributes>). This is used to define that the field is part of a 1-1 relation.

tr.td: Class name of the related entity
Whether the field should be fetched immediately
Whether the field can store nulls.
Name of the field that owns the relation (specified on the inverse side)

subsection.name: Metadata for many-to-one tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <many-to-one> tag (under <attributes>). This is used to define that the field is part of a N-1 relation.

tr.td: Class name of the related entity
Whether the field should be fetched immediately
Whether the field can store nulls.

subsection.name: Metadata for element-collection tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <element-collection> tag (under <attributes>). This is used to define that the field is part of a 1-N non-PC relation.

tr.td: Class name of the related object
Whether the field should be fetched immediately

subsection.name: Metadata for one-to-many tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <one-to-many> tag (under <attributes>). This is used to define that the field is part of a 1-N relation.

tr.td: Class name of the related entity
Whether the field should be fetched immediately
Name of the field that owns the relation (specified on the inverse side)
Whether to remove orphans when either removng the owner or removing the element

subsection.name: Metadata for many-to-many tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <many-to-many> tag (under <attributes>). This is used to define that the field is part of a M-N relation.

tr.td: Class name of the related entity
Whether the field should be fetched immediately
Name of the field on the non-owning side that completes the relation. Specified on the owner side

subsection.name: Metadata for embedded tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <embedded> tag (under <attributes>). This is used to define that the field is part of an embedded relation.

subsection.name: Metadata for order-by tag
subsection.p: This element is specified under <one-to-many> or <many-to-many>. It is used to define the field(s) of the element class that is used for ordering the elements when they are retrieved from the datastore. It has no attributes and the ordering is specified within the element itself. It should be a comma-separated list of field names (of the element) with optional "ASC" or "DESC" to signify ascending or descending

subsection.name: Metadata for order-column tag
subsection.p: This element is specified under <one-to-many> or <many-to-many>. It is used to define that the List will be ordered with the ordering stored in a surrogate column in the other table.

tr.td: Some vague JPA term that you put anything in and get any unexpected results from
Origin of the ordering (value for the first element)

subsection.name: Metadata for map-key tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <map-key> tag (under <one-to-many> or <many-to-many>). This is used to define the field of the value class that is the key of a Map.

subsection.name: Metadata for map-key-temporal tag
subsection.p: Within the <map-key-temporal> tag (under <element-collection>, <one-to-many> or <many-to-many>) you put the TemporalType value.

subsection.name: Metadata for map-key-enumerated tag
subsection.p: Within the <map-key-enumerated> tag (under <element-collection>, <one-to-many> or <many-to-many>) you put the EnumType value.

subsection.name: Metadata for transient tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <transient> tag (under <attributes>). This is used to define that the field is not to be persisted.

subsection.name: Metadata for index tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <index> element. This is used to define the details of an index when overriding the provider default.

tr.td: List of columns (including any ASC, DESC specifications for each column)

subsection.name: Metadata for foreign-key tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <foreign-key> element. This is used to define the details of a foreign-key when overriding the provider default.

tr.td: The DDL for the foreign key

subsection.name: Metadata for convert tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <convert> element, under <basic>. This is used to define the use of type conversion on this field.

tr.td: Name of the embedded field to convert (optional). Not yet supported
Whether to disable any auto-apply converters for this field

subsection.name: Metadata for exclude-default-listeners tag
subsection.p: This element is specified under <mapped-superclass> or <entity> and is used to denote that any default listeners defined in this file will be ignored.

subsection.name: Metadata for exclude-superclass-listeners tag
subsection.p: This element is specified under <mapped-superclass> or <entity> and is used to denote that any listeners of superclasses will be ignored.

subsection.name: Metadata for entity-listener tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <entity-listener> tag (under <entity-listeners>). This is used to an EntityListener class and the methods it uses

tr.td: Name of the EntityListener class that receives the callbacks for this Entity

subsection.name: Metadata for pre-persist tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <pre-persist> tag (under <entity>). This is used to define any "PrePersist" method callback.

subsection.name: Metadata for post-persist tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <post-persist> tag (under <entity>). This is used to define any "PostPersist" method callback.

subsection.name: Metadata for pre-remove tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <pre-remove> tag (under <entity>). This is used to define any "PreRemove" method callback.

subsection.name: Metadata for post-remove tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <post-remove> tag (under <entity>). This is used to define any "PostRemove" method callback.

subsection.name: Metadata for pre-update tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <pre-remove> tag (under <entity>). This is used to define any "PreUpdate" method callback.

subsection.name: Metadata for post-update tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <post-update> tag (under <entity>). This is used to define any "PostUpdate" method callback.

subsection.name: Metadata for post-load tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <post-load> tag (under <entity>). This is used to define any "PostLoad" method callback.

subsection.name: Metadata for attribute-override tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <attribute-override> tag (under <entity>). This is used to override the columns for any fields in superclasses

subsection.name: Metadata for association-override tag
subsection.p: These are attributes within the <association-override> tag (under <entity>). This is used to override the columns for any N-1/1-1 fields in superclasses
